result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rachel A. Adams

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Rachel A. Adams in court with attorney Eric Sheets. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard:  14CT163, 15CM355
1:30 p.m.  Court calls the case.  

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
14CT163 Count 1 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 14CT163 Count 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
14CT163 Count 2 is dismissed. 
15CM355 is dismissed and read-in. 

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Sheets makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
14CT163 Count 1 - 
5 days jail.  All 5 days can be served on GPS Electronic Monitoring.
Huber for employment and any counseling she may be involved in. 
1 day credit.
Pay fine and costs totaling $1,379.00.
Pay $26.45 blood draw fee.
12 month revocation.  Retroactive to the date of the administrative suspension. 
12 months IID.
DOT Assessment and comply with the Driver Safety Plan to reinstate. 
Any bond monies posted shall be applied against the fine and costs.  Balance due within 60 days or set up a payment plan today. 
Submit DNA sample. 

Court advises of post-conviction relief.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 13, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on June 27, 2016 at 10:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: Defendant's Authorization for Attorney to Appear and Act - Atty Sheets

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: $2,000 sig bond:  No abusive or violent contact with L.K. or A.K.

Defendant Rachel A. Adams in court with attorney Eric Sheets. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
P/NG entered.
BTC: $2,000 sig bond:  No abusive or violent contact with L.K. or A.K.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 2, 2015 at 10:00 am.
